title: What should I do after my BSc? - Quora
tags: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

response.answer_text: Through my observations and experience in the software industry, Masters degree for a software developer is only beneficial if you do it immediately after your bachelors. The reason why I say this is because in the software development world, experience and projects trumps masters degrees. A hiring manager will usually choose a developer with a bachelors and 5 years experience then a person with a Masters with 0 years experience. You can fact check me on this, but also, money wise, on average a professional with the same amount of experience who holds a bscs vs a professional with a masters of cs get paid virtually the same. The difference is no more then 10 - 20 k. It usually costs around 20k to obtain a Masters. Now, in the software industry, it is pretty challenging to get a job straight out of school because managers usually want developers with experience. There are way more mid-level/senior level jobs then junior level. This is when the masters degree comes in handy, if you have a masters degree with 0 experience, you will get the job much much easier then someone with no experience and a bachelors.....and you will get a much bigger starting salary with someone with just a bachelors....but as the years go buy, the bachelor degree holder can catch the master degree holder in pay pretty swiftly.So to answer your question, "What should you do after your BSCS ?" A) If you want to make money right away, start applying for jobs and try your best to get that first project. b) If money isn't important to you and you want to learn more in school, you can continue with a Masters and get a bigger starting salary 2 -3 years later. c) You can go for PHD if you want to teach in acadamia /research.d) stay home do nothing but play video games, eat and drink all day. Hope this helps, but what ever you choose you are in a win win situation. You already have a BsCS, which is the most sought after degree in the USA and world, you will one day be rich regardless. Enjoy

After the completion of the B. Sc. degree there are various options available for the science students, they can go for master degree in Science i.e. M. Sc., go in a research area and can even look for professional job oriented courses. M. Sc. or Master of Science: M. Sc. is the most obvious and logical choice for B. Sc graduates when it comes to higher studies. Master degree in a specialized subject can open a lot of door for doctorate, research and excellent employment opportunities for students. MBA or Master of Business Administrations: This is one of the most sought after career choice for graduates of every stream, and B. Sc graduates are not an exception to this rule. Many institutes have started offering MBA degrees with specialization in scientific domains like hospital management, laboratory management and IT management that are ideal for B. Sc graduates. MBA gives you the confidence to pursue your dreams and gives you a force to innovate and experiment. A management degree polishes your managerial skills making you to work towards the goal of the application with greater productivity and lesser cost. The course makes you acquainted with all the aspects of running a company. It grooms the person to serve the best to oneself – only then can he be an asset to an organization. MCA or Master of Computer Application: With the IT boom dominating Indian economy, computer applications and IT industry has emerged as one of the most lucrative career options available to B. Sc degree holders. For students who want to pursue their higher studies in this domain, MCA is an ideal academic programme. B.Ed or Bachelor of Education: For B. Sc graduates, who have the potential to be expert teachers, B.Ed degree would be an excellent choice of further studies. B.Ed degree coaches the students into different and unique pedagogy techniques that aid them in improving their teaching prowess even further. List of few colleges: Anna University, ChennaiUniversity of Allahabad, AllahabadLovely Professional University, JalandharBanaras Hindu UniversityBangalore UniversityUttar Pradesh Technical University
